trend_summary: Core government grid stays constant, but the southern waterfront converts from low-rise industry to high-rise mixed use. Two new sports venues and several bridges appear, vacant lots infill, and riverbank landscaping expands. Overall built-up footprint thickens and greenspace along the Anacostia becomes more structured.
notable_changes: Construction and completion of a large baseball stadium on the southwest riverfront, replacing warehouses.
New soccer/entertainment arena added just west of the baseball park in the latest image set.
Dozens of mid-rise residential and office blocks rise in Navy Yard corridor, filling former parking lots.
Old 11th Street bridge spans replaced by wider dual bridges with improved approaches.
Riverbank on east side reshaped into parkland with more tree cover and formal paths.
